intro: Ruellia tubiflora f. caesiolineata, commonly known as the blue-veined ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have prominent veins that give it its distinctive appearance. The flowers, which bloom in summer, are usually purple or blue and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
